title: Why are there so many bad self published books on Amazon? - Quora

response.answer_text: The interesting thing is not how many bad books are on Amazon, considering there are literally millions of books listed now. The interesting thing is how many really great books are on Amazon which Trad publishers blew the author off over, forcing them to be Indie published, after which they laughed in the face of Trad publishers trying to pick them after after being a huge success. The interesting thing is how many truly terrible books became best sellers, and were picked up for movies. The wonder is not about bad books on Amazon. When anyone can upload a book, and millions do, having a high percent of bad books is a given. The wonder is, of the millions of books uploaded, with something like 1000 new ones every day, how many of them are NOT bad books! As far as bad books go, if all you see is bad books, all I can say is :- You’re looking in the wrong place for your reading.

There are so many badly written self-published books on Amazon simply because it’s possible to self-publish any book, even a bad one, on Amazon. If you’re looking for something to blame, you may as well blame the internet as a whole, because if it weren’t for Amazon and Smashwords, the bad writing would still be out there, and the people who write it would still be expecting money for their “immortal prose.” If a book is badly written, self-publishing isn’t the cause of it being bad. It’s just that a self-published author doesn’t have to bother with all the “trivia” (please note the sarcasm quotes!) of editing and proofreading and just making sure the book is readable… so some don’t bother with any of that.
